title: Part A (i)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that the most likely cause is a random mutation. (The response also does not indicate that differential gene activation in some organisms under different environmental conditions is possible.)
The response indicates that the most likely cause is a random mutation. (However, differential gene activation in some organisms under different environmental conditions is also possible.)

title: Part A (ii)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that each increasing concentration of artesunate selected for only those members of the artesunate-sensitive Plasmodium population that could survive and reproduce, and eventually only artesunate-resistant organisms remained to reproduce.

The response indicates that each increasing concentration of artesunate selected for only those members of the artesunate-sensitive Plasmodium population that could survive and reproduce, and eventually only artesunate-resistant organisms remained to reproduce.

title: Part B (i)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The sketched bars meet none of the criteria below.
The sketched bars meet one of the criteria below.
The sketched bars meet two of the criteria below.
The sketched bars meet all of the criteria below.

title: Part D (i)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that a mutation had occurred to the gene encoding the Plasmodium ligand so that the protein changed its conformation and specificity.
The response indicates that a mutation had occurred to the gene encoding the Plasmodium ligand so that the protein changed its conformation and specificity.

title: Part D (ii)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that if the Plasmodium organisms infecting the two different types of cells can no longer successfully interbreed and produce offspring that can undergo successful sexual reproduction, then the Plasmodium has evolved into two separate species.

The response indicates that if the Plasmodium organisms infecting the two different types of cells can no longer successfully interbreed and produce offspring that can undergo successful sexual reproduction, then the Plasmodium has evolved into two separate species.
